conversation.en_sentence: Oh, you will be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたなら大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I will make sure to make an extra copy of his medicine chart for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の薬表を余分にコピーしておきますので。

conversation.en_sentence: Also you might get asked to sleep in his suite depending on the situation..
conversation.ja_sentence: それから状況によっては、彼の部屋に泊まってと言われるかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: He is elderly and his health is not in a great shape.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼はお年だし、体調もそんなに良くないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: He needs to have someone nearby in case something happens to him in his sleep.
conversation.ja_sentence: 就寝中にもし何か起こった時の為に、誰かが近くに居ないといけないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: You don't have to stay up all night to keep an eye on him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 様子を見る為に一晩中起きてなくても大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: Just stay in his suite in case he needs your assistance.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし助けが必要になった時の為に彼のスイーツに居るだけです。

conversation.en_sentence: Another thing you need to pay attention is his diet.
conversation.ja_sentence: あともう一つ気をつけてもらいたい事は食事です。

conversation.en_sentence: You might know this already, but he is on a strict diet.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう知っているかもしれませんが、彼は食事制限中です。

conversation.en_sentence: However, he does not like to be told what to eat.
conversation.ja_sentence: けれども、彼は食事について指示されるのを非常に嫌がるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: So you will have to give him acceptable choices.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、良さそうな食事の選択肢を与えて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: That way Mr. Takano still feels like he has some control.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうすると、高野さんも自分でコントロールしている気分になります。

conversation.en_sentence: I understand how you feel.
conversation.ja_sentence: その気持ちはわかりますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: But I need you to man up and do these things.

conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise, he would not have anybody helping him.

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I am pretty sure Mr. Takano will enjoy your company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 高野さんはあなたと一緒に過ごす時間を楽しむと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for coming to our office today.

conversation.en_sentence: Where is your office?

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that's pretty close.

conversation.en_sentence: Anyways, I wanted to take this opportunity to introduce our company, Company B.

conversation.en_sentence: And maybe afterwards you can explain a bit about Company A.

conversation.en_sentence: So I work for Company B, which is a Japanese trading company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日系商社の事業内容はよくご存知ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: A general definition I like to give is a company that does commodity trading and project investments in an array of industries.
conversation.ja_sentence: お伝えしたい一般的な定義は商品取引と幅広い業界へのプロジェクト投資といったところです。

conversation.en_sentence: So we work in industries like aerospace, forestry, mining, textiles, and many more.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、航空、林業、鉱業、繊維など、その他たくさんの業界で事業を展開しております。

conversation.en_sentence: So our office in Seattle focuses on forestry and aircrafts.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、このシアトルオフィスは、林業と航空機に重点をおいています。

conversation.en_sentence: On the forestry side, we export logs in the Pacific Northwest to the Asian market.

conversation.en_sentence: And for aircrafts, we are the sales agent for Company D for the Japanese market.
conversation.ja_sentence: 航空機に関しては、日本市場向けにD社の販売代理店を務めております。

conversation.en_sentence: So our offices will focus on industries depending on their location.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですから、我々のオフィスは、ロケーションによって異なる業界に特化します。

conversation.en_sentence: For example, our Houston office is focused on the oil and gas industry, and our San Jose office is focused on the tech industry.

conversation.en_sentence: We have 16 people.

conversation.en_sentence: They typically stay here for five years before going back to Japan.

conversation.en_sentence: So surprisingly, most of us here were hired locally.

conversation.en_sentence: How about you?

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the information.

conversation.ja_sentence: 進捗についての大まかな概要と、開発経費の概算をご提供頂ければ結構です。

conversation.en_sentence: We will come in for an audit in the beginning to decide what your estimated expense would be.

conversation.en_sentence: So you don't have to worry too much about it.

conversation.en_sentence: However, if there is an unexpected cost, then you should report it.

conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仰る通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: I can send you an information package later today for you to review.

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.

conversation.en_sentence: Whichever works better for you.

conversation.en_sentence: As you know, we are a Japanese trading company.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご存知のように、弊社は日本の貿易会社です。

conversation.en_sentence: So we do a lot of commodity trading in various industries.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、様々な業界との商品取引があります。

conversation.en_sentence: But regardless of the product traded, the procedures for exporting or importing are generally the same.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、どのような商品の取引であっても、一般的に輸出入の手順は同じです。

conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: Your task will mainly be preparing export documents for products from North America going to Asia.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの職務は主に、北米からアジアへの輸出品に関する輸出書類を用意することになります。

conversation.en_sentence: Elaine in our department will teach you how it's done later.
conversation.ja_sentence: あとで、当部署のエレインさんにやり方を説明してもらいます。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any questions so far?
conversation.ja_sentence: ここまで何か質問はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Feel free to ask questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご自由に質問してくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: You might not now what questions to ask now but that's completely normal.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今はまだどんな質問をすればいいか分からないかも知れないですが、それは全く普通のことですから。

conversation.en_sentence: So we have fourteen people in our office including you.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、弊社オフィスにはあなたを入れて14名います。

conversation.en_sentence: We currently have 4 staff in our department.
conversation.ja_sentence: この部署の現スタッフ数は4人です。

conversation.en_sentence: Five including you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたを入れて5人になります。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll show you to your desk in a bit.
conversation.ja_sentence: 後で席まで案内しますね。

conversation.en_sentence: You can let me know if you need anything for your table.
conversation.ja_sentence: デスクに必要なものがあれば言ってください。

conversation.en_sentence: Like an additional monitor, desk trays, things like that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 追加のモニターやデスクトレー、そういったものです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll explain a bit about our other departments now.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、他の部署について少し説明します。

conversation.en_sentence: We also have a mining department and they have four staff there.
conversation.ja_sentence: 鉱業部門があり、スタッフは4名です。

conversation.en_sentence: Their main operation is managing mine assets in North America.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らの主な業務は、北米の鉱山資産の管理です。

conversation.en_sentence: Our admin department has five staff and they handle everything from HR, accounting, and any office administration.
conversation.ja_sentence: 総務部のスタッフは5人で、人事から経理、他のオフィス事務まで何でも手掛けています。

conversation.en_sentence: How about we show you your desk now?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、お席に案内しましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I think you are perfect for the position.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだ、君にぴったりの役職だと思うんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not just talking about Multinational team, I'm talking about the entire Sales Group.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多国籍チームだけの話じゃない、営業グループ全体について言ってるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: This may be a good opportunity to restructure the Sales Group.
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業チームを再構築するのにこれは良い機会になる。

conversation.en_sentence: So although I was initially thinking just team leaders and abolishing group manager, maybe we should have an experienced group manager after all so team leader positions could be given to more recent hires.
conversation.ja_sentence: 始めはチームリーダーだけにしてグループマネージャーを廃止しようと考えてたんだが、チームリーダーの役割を新しい社員に任せられるよう、やはり経験豊富なグループマネージャーがいるべきかもしれない。

conversation.en_sentence: You basically take over her entire package.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女のパッケージをそのまま引き継ぐんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Pay, benefits, the whole nine yards, so to speak.
conversation.ja_sentence: 給料、待遇、言ってみれば、何もかもだ。

conversation.en_sentence: First and foremost, she doesn't want any more responsibilities.
conversation.ja_sentence: まずは何よりもね、彼女はこれ以上の責任を負いたくないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: She has made that clear.
conversation.ja_sentence: それははっきりと言われた。

conversation.en_sentence: You know her family situation, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女の家庭状況、知ってるよな？

conversation.en_sentence: She really wants to focus on her family right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今はとにかく家族を大切にしたいんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why she doesn't work full time.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでフルタイムで働かないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Second of all, it's about time you're rewarded for your work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 二つ目にはね、そろそろ君の仕事が評価される時期だろ。

conversation.en_sentence: You mention that often.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はそれをよく口にするよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Not so, I went to Cambridge.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念、僕はケンブリッジ卒だ。

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko loves people who graduated high caliber schools.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社長は優秀校の卒業生が大好きなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: She thinks it's an indication of something.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが何か意味あることだと思ってるのさ。

conversation.en_sentence: To me it's an indication of nothing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕にとっては何の意味もないけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: All I care about is results.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大切なのは結果のみだ。

conversation.en_sentence: You have built up the Small Cap group all by yourself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はスモールキャップグループを一人で立ち上げてきた。

conversation.en_sentence: You have enough experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経験は十分にある。

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko thinks highly of you and this one is my decision.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女は君を高く評価してるし、これは僕の決断だ。

conversation.en_sentence: All I have to do is have Sylvester's approval and I'm confident I can get this through.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必要なのはシルベスターの承諾だけだし、僕にはこれを押し切る自信がある。

conversation.en_sentence: So are you in?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、やってみるかい？

conversation.en_sentence: I am very honored to be here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 呼んでいただけてとても光栄です。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, Mr. Ko.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、コーさん。

conversation.en_sentence: Although I think "company" is an overstatement.
conversation.ja_sentence: 「会社」というのは大げさだとは思いますが。

conversation.en_sentence: It was a one man operation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 1人で経営してたんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I was basically just making one lens after another, and submitting patents.
conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的には、ただレンズを一つ一つ作り、特許を出願していました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, well, engineers don't tend to go for PhDs.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、まあ通常エンジニアは博士号まで目指しませんから。

conversation.en_sentence: We are content with a masters.
conversation.ja_sentence: 修士号で満足するんです。

conversation.en_sentence: But I did a lot of work with universities and I was close with one doctoral advisor.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも私は大学関係の仕事が多くて、博士課程の指導教員の一人と仲が良かったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: He advised me I might as well do a PhD since the work I was doing was equivalent to what I would do in a PhD program.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私がしている仕事はPhDプログラムでやるのと同等だから、博士号を取得したほうがいいって、彼がアドバイスしてくれたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Basically all I had to do was submit a dissertation and defend it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 要するに、ただ論文を提出しそれを証明すれば良かったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: About 110.
conversation.ja_sentence: 約110個です。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, that's the problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、それが問題でして。

conversation.en_sentence: I had about 200 patents so far, but I had to sell nearly half of them.
conversation.ja_sentence: それまで200ほど特許があったんですが、半分近くを売らなければなりませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: At the end of the day, lens alone won't get me anywhere, unfortunately.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結局、レンズ単体ではどうにもならないんですよ、残念ながら。

conversation.en_sentence: It's always used with something else, and if that something else is made by a large corporation, they basically take advantage of the fact that they have more power.
conversation.ja_sentence: レンズは必ず何か他のものと使われますし、その何かが大企業によって生産されていれば、結局はより力があるという事実を企業が上手く利用しますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: They know I need their business more than they need me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らが私を必要とする以上に、私が彼らのビジネスを必要としてるって分かっているんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's that at a cheap price or "not interested".
conversation.ja_sentence: 安い値段で売るか、そうでなければ「興味ありません」ってわけです。

conversation.en_sentence: From my point of view, no.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の見解では、いいえ、です。

conversation.en_sentence: And that is why I have decided that just doing this myself is fruitless.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですからそれが理由で、自分1人でやっているだけでは無益だと決断したんです。

conversation.en_sentence: It's better to work with others to create something bigger.
conversation.ja_sentence: より大きなものを作るには他者と働くほうが良いと。

conversation.en_sentence: But I don't want to be a cog in a big corporation.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも私は大企業で歯車にはなりたくはないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to work somewhere that will appreciate my specialty and will able to utilize to the full extent what I make.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の専門性を評価し、私が作るものを最大限に活用してくれる場所で働きたかったんです。
